{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3644243,"name":"Vyom Desai","username":"vdesai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vdesai/{size}/260581_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-03T03:40:32.145Z","cooked":"

My team is thinking about swapping the Kraken X60s used to steer our swerve modules with X44s. Has any team done this yet (preferably with SDS Mk4s)? If so, I would be grateful if you can tell me how y’all did it and provide feedback on the results.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-06-03T03:40:32.145Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":522,"readers_count":521,"score":244.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502739,"topic_slug":"kraken-x44s-as-steering-motor","display_username":"Vyom Desai","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4926 Student"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x44s-as-steering-motor/502739/1","custom_user_title":"4926 Student","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3644245,"name":"Ryan Stockton","username":"rstockton429","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rstockton429/{size}/179783_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-03T03:53:02.399Z","cooked":"

This post shows how we did it on our MK4C modules. Was just a 1/8" Thick plate that adapted to the Kraken X44 bolt circle. We cut the motor shafts down so we didn’t have to have the weight of the motor spacers but you could use the same plate with motor spacers.

2025 Robonauts CAD and Code Release Robot Showcase
On the non inverted MK4 modules the motor shafts interfere with the steering pulley and propulsion gears if there are no spacers. [SDS_Mk4C_No_Spacers] Removing these 1/2" thick motor spacers is where the majority of the weight savings came from. [Screenshot 2025-05-24 115138] This was our final implementation of the motor mounting with the shortened motor shafts and pinions held on with retaining rings. A big reason we did this instead of using small spacers to stand off the motor is to ha…

We also used KrakenX44s as steering motors, though we did this on WCP Swerve X2t modules. They worked perfectly and were a simple drop-in replacement on the WCP modules.

check out this thread.

Kraken X44 Steering Adapter Plates for SDS MK4i and MK4n CAD
Are you headed to the Championship and frantically trying to save a pound or two to complete your final upgrades while still making weight? Are you using SDS MK4i or MK4n swerve modules? We are. An obvious candidate to us was to swap our steering motors from X60s to X44s. This is the standard configuration on the WCP X2S and X2St and an optional configuration on their full-size X2i and X2t, but it is not possible by default on SDS’s offerings. So we made these adapter plates to do the job. Ou…

We made our own top plates for the Mk4i with the right mounting pattern.

SDS MK5n Swerve Module General Forum
Hello, unfortunately with the way the plates were designed deriving several of the bore features from the mk4i top plate they’re not DFM with waterjet in mind. Regardless, here’s a STEP file for our x44 adapted mk4i top plates for those interested Modified Mk4i Top Plate - x44 Mounting
